intro: Fuirena claviseta, commonly known as the key-leafed fuirena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive key-like shape, giving it its common name. Its small, white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Fuirena claviseta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
